document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the genus Sirthenea (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) of the Old World

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the genus Sirthenea (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) of the Old World

bibRefCitation.author: Distant, W. L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Distant, W. L. (1903) Rhynchotal Miscellanea (Second Series). Annals of the South African Museum, 3, 43 - 62.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Sirthenea africana
Distant, 1903 : 47
. Syntype (s) ( ♂ ): Pretoria: Republic of South Africa ; NHMUK.

Sirthenea rapax
Horváth, 1909 : 360
. Syntype (s) ( ♂ ): Cameroon ; HNHM. Syn. nov.

Sirthenea leonina
Horváth, 1909 : 360
. Syntype (s) ( ♀ ): Sierra Leone ; HNHM. Syn. nov.

Sirthenea bequaerti
Schouteden, 1913 : 435
. Lectotype ( ♂ ) ( Schouteden 1931: 146, by use of “le type” ): Belgian Congo [= Democratic Republic of Congo ]: Mufungura; RMCA. Syn. nov.

Sirthenea leontovitchi
Schouteden, 1931 : 146
. Holotype ( ♂ ): Democratic Republic of Congo : Bambesa ; RMCA. Syn. nov.

Diagnosis. This species is similar to
S. rodhaini
but can be easily distinguished from it by the distinct pale areas in the basal part of corium ( Figs. 2 , 193 ) and the pale apical part of membrane (hemelytron of
S. rodhaini
is dark, without pale markings, cf. Figs. 41 , 197 ), the very slender left paramere, long and thin pedicel of aedeagus as well as the delicately curved posterior margin of the posterior pronotal lobe.

Redescription. Color : Body black or brown with pale markings on hemelytron ( Figs. 2 , 193 ). Head and all labial segments light brown to dark brown with seate of same color or slightly darker. Dark stripes under antennifer (from anterior margin of eye to apical part of head; visible variability in color intensity of stripes in different specimens), basal part of basiflagellum. Scape, basi- and distiflagellum as well as intercalar segments pale. Pedicel and basiflagellum with darker basal part. Apical part of pedicel pale (some representatives with unicolorous dark scape or only basal part paler). Eyes and ocelli dark. Ocelli rounded by dark annulus (brown to black). Pronotum uni- or bicolorous. Anterior pronotal lobe pale brown (darker than head) or darker in same color as posterior lobe (if anterior pronotal lobe dark then head in same color). Posterior pronotal lobe pale in anterior part or entirely dark brown (darker than anterior lobe, sometimes black). Scutellum dark brown to black with distinctly paler lateral margins and black apex. Hemelytron dark brown to black with paler markings in basal part ( Figs. 2 , 193 ). Pale markings covering a various area of basal part of corium. Apical part of membrane whitish. Legs, mesepimeron, apical part of mesepisternum and metepisternum pale. Abdomen beneath black with a pale, longitudinal spot on ventral side. Connexives dark (black or dark brown), bicolorous (anterior half pale, posterior half dark) or pale. Connexives of second and seventh segment pale (specimens with pale and bicolorous connexives) or dark (specimens with dark connexives). Pygophore pale with dark, irregular spots.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 3–14.
Sirthenea africana Distant, 1903: 3
—styloids, outer view; 4—gonapophysis of VIII segment, inner view; 5— gonocoxite of VIII segment, inner view; 6—pygophore, dorsal view; 7—left paramere, inner view; 8—left paramere, outer view; 9—right paramere, inner view; 10—right paramere, outer view; 11—median process of pygophore, lateral view; 12— phallus, right lateral view; 13—phallus, left lateral view; 14—phallus, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements (in mm, male in parentheses): Body length: 19.5–22.3 (15.6–20.7); maximum width of abdomen: 3.6–5.1 (3.2–4.3); head length: 3.1–4.4 (2.8–3.7); head width: 2.2–2.5 (1.8–2.3); length of anteocular part: 1.7–2.5 (1.6–2.1); length of postocular part: 0.5–0.8 (0.7–0.9); length of synthlipsis: 0.9–1.2 (0.8–1.1); interocellar distance: 0.6–0.8 (0.5–0.7); length of antennal segments I:II:III:IV: 1.0–1.3 (1.0–1.2): 1.7–2.25 (1.7– 2.5): 1.5–1.9 (1.6–2.0): 1.8–2.0 (1.7–1.9); length of visible labial segments I:II:III: 1.0–1.2 (0.7–1.3): 2.5–3.3 (2.1– 3.4): 1.0–1.6 (1.2–1.9); maximum length of anterior pronotal lobe: 2.2–3.3 (2.2–3.0); maximum length of posterior pronotal lobe: 1.4–1.9 (1.3–2.0); maximum width of anterior pronotal lobe: 3.3–4.4 (3.0–4.0); maximum width of posterior pronotal lobe: 3.9–5.25 (3.4–5.0); length of scutellum: 1.3–1.8 (1.0–1.7); length of hemelytron: 11.1–13.8 (10.4–13.4).

Distribution : Botswana , Cameroon , Democratic Republic of Congo , Ethiopia , Gabon , Ghana , Ivory Coast , Malawi , Mozambique , Nigeria , Republic of South Africa (Transvaal, Pretoria), Sierra Leone , Sudan , Tanzania (including Zanzibar ), Uganda , Zambia (Map 1).

Comments : The species exhibits a certain degree of color variability, mainly concerning the color of connexives and the size of the pale area in the basal part of corium. Specimens from the northern part of its area ( Ethiopia , Ghana , Ivory Coast , Nigeria , Sierra Leone , Sudan ) are characterized by black connexives and only the basal part of corium as well as basal third to half of clavus being pale. The connexives of specimens from the central part of distribution of the species ( Cameroon , Democratic Republic of Congo , Gabon , Uganda , Zanzibar ) are bicolorous (pale anterior half and dark posterior half), and the pale markings on basal part of corium reach apex of clavus. Connexives of specimens from the southern part of the area of this species ( Botswana , Malawi , Mozambique , Republic of South Africa , Zambia ) are usually pale or bicolorous (with small surface covered by dark pigment), with hemelytron provided with small pale markings only at base.

The described variability includes also specimens with transitional characters. Color variability of all examined specimens clearly shows a certain gradient of coloration along the entire range of occurrence of the species.
